author: Staff Reporter
text:
Rs. 147 crore road development project inaugurated

Now, people can hope for a reprieve from a long and bumpy journey on Tiruchendur Road as a much awaited road infrastructure development project has been taken up on the battered stretch.

Not only to Tiruchendur, a famous pilgrimage town in Tuticorin district, this project extends upto Periyathalai.

Tourism Minister S.P. Shunmuganathan inaugurated the Rs.147-crore project at Mukkani on Tiruchendur Road in the presence of Collector M. Ravikumar on Saturday. Several tourists bound for Tiruchendur are looking forward to this development project.

In the initial stage, the existing Tiruchendur Road would be widened to a length of 8.60 kilometres with four-lane from Kamaraj College to Mullakadu. After completing this stretch, the 8.75-km-long road from Mullakadu to Mukkani would be widened.

First phase

The first phase of work would cover 17.35 kilometres at an estimated cost of Rs.76.70 crore. As for the second phase of this project, the 20.06-km stretch of the road under Tiruchendur subdivision would be developed at an estimated cost of Rs.71.60 crore, sources in Highways department said.

V. Krishnasamy, Highways Divisional Engineer, and Mariappan, Assistant Divisional Engineer, were present on the occasion.
title: A reprieve from the bumpy ride on Tiruchendur Road
